Section_A.directions: In this section, you will hear three news reports. At the end of each news report, you will hear two or three questions. Both the news report and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

options.A: Heavy floods.
options.B: Safety concerns.
options.C: Bad economy.
options.D: Workers’ strikes.

options.A: lt is competitive with its numerous tourist destinations.
options.B: It provides many job opportunities for French people.
options.C: It is the biggest concern of the French government.
options.D: It plays an important role in the nation’ s economy.

options.C: Do something fun and creative.

Section_B.directions: In this section, you will hear two long conversations. At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions. Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

options.A: To confirm an urgent appointment.
options.B: To collect a package from the woman.
options.C: To ask the woman to sign a document.
options.D: To arrange the delivery of a package.

options.A: She is doing shopping.
options.B: She is visiting a friend.
options.C: She is not at home.
options.D: She is not feeling well.

options.A: He will be off duty the whole day.
options.B: He will be working somewhere else.
options.C: He will have to have his car repaired.
options.D: He will be too busy to spare any time.

options.A: Sign her name.

options.A: Say goodbye to the woman at the airport.

options.C: Drive the woman to the airport.
options.D: Have lunch with the woman.

Section_C.directions: In this section, you will hear three passages. At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions. Both the passage and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

options.A: It has kept growing over the centuries.
options.B: Its top is hidden in clouds of volcanic smoke.
options.C: Its height changes with each volcanic eruption.
options.D: It has a recorded history of 1500 years.
